page.title: 14ROMAN MILESTONE
page.content: In 1771 workmen digging for gravel discovered an extremely well preserved {Roman milestone}.It was found 2 miles from Leicester,close to the old Roman FosseWay,on land which is now occupied by Rushey Mead Secondary School. The inscription on the milestone tells us that it was erected in A.D.120 during the reign of Emperor Hadrian Augustus.It provides the earliest evidence of the Roman name for Leicester,Ratae Coritanorum. After its discovery the milestone narrowly escaped being used as a garden roller.In 1783 it was set up by the Corporation in Belgrave Gate as the base for a lamp standard.The lamp was replaced by a cross in 1824 when the milestone was painted.In 1849 it was transferred to the Town Museum and is now prominently displayed in the Jewry Wall Museum,Leicester.
